section.name: Sushi
section.p: Sushi provides general purpose Java Code like Jakarta Commons.
IO, Xml, Cli, Metadata, Properties, Csv

Some classes provide Ant-like functionality like file sets, copying, ssh- and svn access (similar to Ant 1.7's resource framework). I like to do scripting tasks in Java (where others perfer Ant, shell scripts or Python).
Sushi is split into 3 modules. The Core module collects code with no dependencies on external library (not even for logging), all you need is Java 5. The other modules depend on specific libraries.
I know there's Jakarta Commons, but I don't like their code.
